kr.ac.kaist.team888.bezier

Class ParametricPolynomialCurve

  • java.lang.Object
    • kr.ac.kaist.team888.bezier.ParametricPolynomialCurve
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.UnivariateVectorFunction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BezierCurve

    public class ParametricPolynomialCurve
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.UnivariateVectorFunction
    Parametric curve in 2D plane represented by two polynomials of time.

    The general form of this curve C is C(t)=[sum a_i t^i, sum b_i t^i] where t, a_i, and b_i are real numbers. Thus, C is the function from R to R^2.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParametricPolynomialCurve

        protected ParametricPolynomialCurve()

      • ParametricPolynomialCurve

        public ParametricPolynomialCurve(org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.polynomials.PolynomialFunction[] polynomials)
                          throws org.apache.commons.math3.exception.DimensionMismatchException,
                                 org.apache.commons.math3.exception.NullArgumentException
        Creates a new parametric polynomial curve with given polynomials.

        This restricts to receive exactly two polynomials, one is for x-axis and other is for y-axis.

        Parameters:
        polynomials - an array of two polynomials for x-axis and y-axis, respectively
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.math3.exception.DimensionMismatchException - if number of polynomials is not 2
        org.apache.commons.math3.exception.NullArgumentException - if either the array of polynomials or one of polynomial is `null`

      • perpendicular

        public org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.UnivariateVectorFunction perpendicular()
        Returns the function in the form of UnivariateVectorFunction which gives the perpendicular unit vector of the each point on the original curve.

        Perpendicular direction is decided in counter-clockwise.

        Returns:
        the function for perpendicular vector of each point
